title: The Great Train Robbery
brief_description: Edwin S Porter’s The Great Train Robbery is considered one of the first westerns (and action films), which made use of many filmmaking techniques that were unconventional at the time including composite editing, on-location shooting, and frequent camera movement.

constellations_other.name: Gunslingers, good fellas and flea bags
constellations_other.description: Explore how a 1903 western changed the course of filmmaking and videogames by breaking the fourth wall.

constellations_other.name: Outlawed
constellations_other.description: From The Story of the Kelly Gang to Sweet Country, this Constellation explores bushrangers, samurai and bandits.

description: The clerk at the train station is assaulted and left tied by four men, then they rob the train threatening the operator. (They) take all the money and shoot a passenger when trying to run away. A little girl discovers the clerk tied and gives notice to the sheriff, who at once goes along with his men hunting the bandits.
